message_1: A triangle with vertices at points (1, 1), (5, 3), and (3, 6) is given. Using a triangulation with all vertices of the triangle as the vertices of the triangulation, how many triangles can you create?
message_2: Since the given triangle already has three vertices and no additional points are provided for the triangulation, the only triangle that can be created is the given triangle itself. Therefore, you can create 1 triangle using the given vertices.
